Biking.ProductDescription: The forged alloy top and bottom clamps ensure a solid connection to the saddle without adding excessive weight.
A Front Shock typically consists of two blades which are joined at the top by a fork crown.
Tires have tread compounds that specialize in grip and tread patterns with large blocky tread for maximum traction.
Handlebar provides more steering control and is favoured for gravel riding.
Provides more stability on uneven ground and prevents muscles from tensing up.
Act as a rotating crank, part of the crankset, allowing the rider to apply force to the pedal transferred via the crank arm to the forward gears to drive the bicycle chain.
A device for slowing or stopping a vehicle or other moving mechanism by the absorption or transfer of the energy of momentum, usually by means of friction.
